column3: The CURRENT_DATE commandreturns the current date.
The CURRENT_TIME commandreturns the current time.
The CURRENT_TIMESTAMPcommand returns the currentdate and time.
The DATE_PART commandextracts a specific part (e.g.,year, month, day) from a date ortime.
The DATE_ADD command addsor subtracts a specified numberof days, months, or yearsto/from a date.
column4: SELECTDATE_ADD(date_expression,INTERVAL value unit) ASnew_date;
column5: DATE_ADD ExampleSELECTDATE_ADD('2024-04-11',INTERVAL 1 DAY) ASnew_date;DATE_SUB ExampleSELECTDATE_SUB('2024-04-11',INTERVAL 1 DAY) ASnew_date;

column3: The EXTRACT commandextracts a specific part (e.g.,year, month, day) from a date ortime.
column4: SELECT EXTRACT(part FROMdate_expression) ASextracted_part;

column3: The TO_CHAR commandconverts a date or time to aspecified format.
The TIMESTAMPDIFF commandcalculates the differencebetween two timestamps in aspecified unit (e.g., days, hours,minutes).
column4: SELECTTIMESTAMPDIFF(unit,timestamp1, timestamp2)AS difference;

column3: The DATEDIFF commandcalculates the difference in daysbetween two dates.
